original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽8.23. Saññojanasaññojaniyaduka🔽Nasaññojanañceva naasaññojaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaññojano ceva naasaññojaniyo🔽ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasaññojanañceva naasaññojaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽naasaññojaniyo ceva nanoasaññojano ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasaññojanañceva
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  saññojana saññojaniya duka  na saññojanam ca iva na a saññojaniyam ca dhammam paṭicca na saññojanaḥ ca iva na a saññojaniyaḥ  ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na saññojanam ca iva na asaññojaniyam ca dhammam paṭicca  na asaññojaniyaḥ ca iva na no asaññojanaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na saññojanañca ca
translated: The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Ideas🔽The Pair of Doctrinal Ideas on Fetters and Things to be Fettered

original: naasaññojaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaññojano ceva naasaññojaniyo ca naasaññojaniyo🔽ceva nano ca saññojano ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naasaññojaniyañceva nano ca saññojanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naasaññojaniyo ceva nano ca saññojano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na a saññojaniyañca dhammam paṭicca na saññojanaḥ ca iva na a saññojaniyaḥ ca na a saññojaniyaḥ 🔽ca iva nano ca saññojano ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā 🔽na asaññojaniyam ca iva na no ca saññojanam dhammam paṭicca na asaññojaniyaḥ ca iva na no ca saññojanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-fester and a thing not to be fettered as condition, a non-fester comes to be. With a non-fester and a thing not to be fettered as condition, a thing to be fettered comes to be. With a non-fester and a thing not to be fettered as condition, a non-fester and a thing to be fettered come to be.🔽With a thing to be fettered and a fetter as condition, a thing to be fettered comes to be. With a thing to be fettered and a fetter as condition, a fetter comes to be. With a thing to be fettered and a fetter as condition, a thing to be fettered and a fetter come to be.

original: Nasaññojanañceva naasaññojaniyañca naasaññojaniyañceva nanosaññojanañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaññojano ceva naasaññojaniyo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na saññojanam ceva na a saññojaniyam ca na a saññojaniyam ceva na nosaññojanam ca dhammam paṭicca na saññojanaḥ ca iva na a saññojaniyaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is a fetter and is also subject to the fetters, and a state that is subject to the fetters but is not a fetter, are related to a state that is a fetter and is also subject to the fetters, as … related to a state that is subject to the fetters but is not a fetter, as … related to a state that is a fetter and is also subject to the fetters, and to a state that is subject to the fetters but is not a fetter, as … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are nine. In the section on object, there are nine. … In the section on kamma result, there is one. … In the section on the unformed, there are nine. (In each section, the method of exposition should be understood in the way already described.)
